   20: -module(inet_sockopt_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
   24: 
   25: 
   26: -define(C_GET_IPPROTO_TCP,1).
   27: -define(C_GET_IPPROTO_IP,2).
   28: -define(C_GET_SOL_SOCKET,3).
   29: -define(C_GET_SOL_IP,4).
   30: 
   31: -define(C_GET_TCP_KEEPIDLE,11).
   32: -define(C_GET_TCP_LINGER2,12).
   33: -define(C_GET_TCP_INFO,13).
   34: -define(C_GET_SO_REUSEADDR,14).
   35: -define(C_GET_SO_KEEPALIVE,15).
   36: -define(C_GET_SO_LINGER,16).
   37: -define(C_GET_SO_DONTROUTE,17).
   38: 
   39: -define(C_GET_LINGER_SIZE,21).
   40: -define(C_GET_TCP_INFO_SIZE,22).
   41: 
   42: -define(C_GET_OFF_LINGER_L_ONOFF,31).
   43: -define(C_GET_OFF_LINGER_L_LINGER,32).
   44: -define(C_GET_OFF_TCPI_SACKED,33).
   45: -define(C_GET_OFF_TCPI_OPTIONS,34).
   46: 
   47: -define(C_GET_SIZ_LINGER_L_ONOFF,41).
   48: -define(C_GET_SIZ_LINGER_L_LINGER,42).
   49: -define(C_GET_SIZ_TCPI_SACKED,43).
   50: -define(C_GET_SIZ_TCPI_OPTIONS,44).
   51: 
   52: -define(C_QUIT,99).
   53: 
   54: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0,
   55:          init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   56: 	 init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2,
   57:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   58: 	 
   59:          simple/1,
   60:          loop_all/1,
   61:          simple_raw/1, simple_raw_getbin/1, 
   62: 	 multiple_raw/1, multiple_raw_getbin/1,
   63: 	 doc_examples_raw/1, doc_examples_raw_getbin/1,
   64: 	 large_raw/1, large_raw_getbin/1,
   65:          combined/1, combined_getbin/1,
   66: 	 ipv6_v6only_udp/1, ipv6_v6only_tcp/1, ipv6_v6only_sctp/1,
   67: 	 use_ipv6_v6only_udp/1,
   68: 	 type_errors/1,
   69:          windows_reuseaddr/1]).
   70: 
   71: 
   72: suite() ->
   73:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   74:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   75: 
   76: all() -> 
   77:     %% This is a temporary measure to ensure that we can 
   78:     %% test the socket backend without effecting *all*
   79:     %% applications on *all* machines.
   80:     %% This flag is set only for *one* host.
   81:     case ?TEST_INET_BACKENDS() of
   82:         true ->
   83:             [
   84:              {group, inet_backend_default},
   85:              {group, inet_backend_inet},
   86:              {group, inet_backend_socket}
   87:             ];
   88:         _ ->
   89:             [
   90:              {group, inet_backend_default}
   91:             ]
   92:     end.
   93: 
   94: 
   95: groups() -> 
   96:     [
   97:      {inet_backend_default,   [], inet_backend_default_cases()},
   98:      {inet_backend_inet,      [], inet_backend_inet_cases()},
   99:      {inet_backend_socket,    [], inet_backend_socket_cases()}
  100:     ].
  101: 
  102: inet_backend_default_cases() ->
  103:     all_std_cases().
  104: 
  105: inet_backend_inet_cases() ->
  106:     all_std_cases().
  107: 
  108: inet_backend_socket_cases() ->
  109:     all_std_cases().
  110: 
  111: all_std_cases() ->
  112:     [
  113:      simple,
  114:      loop_all,
  115:      simple_raw, simple_raw_getbin,
  116:      multiple_raw, multiple_raw_getbin,
  117:      doc_examples_raw, doc_examples_raw_getbin,
  118:      large_raw, large_raw_getbin,
  119:      combined, combined_getbin,
  120:      ipv6_v6only_udp, ipv6_v6only_tcp, ipv6_v6only_sctp,
  121:      use_ipv6_v6only_udp,
  122:      type_errors,
  123:      windows_reuseaddr
  124:     ].
  125: 
  126: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  127: 
  128:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  129:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  130:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  131: 
  132:     case ?LIB:init_per_suite([{allow_skip, false} | Config0]) of
  133:         {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  134:             SKIP;
  135: 
  136:         Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  137:             
  138:             %% We need a monitor on this node also
  139:             kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  140: 
  141:             ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
  142:                "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  143: 
  144:             Config1
  145:     end.
  146: 
  147: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
  148: 
  149:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  150:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  151:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  152: 
  153:     %% Stop the local monitor
  154:     ?P("init_per_suite -> try stop system monitor"),
  155:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  156: 
  157:     Config1 = ?LIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  158: 
  159:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
  160:             "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  161: 
  162:     Config1.
  163: 
  164: init_per_group(inet_backend_default = _GroupName, Config) ->
  165:     [{socket_create_opts, []} | Config];
  166: init_per_group(inet_backend_inet = _GroupName, Config) ->
  167:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  168:         true ->
  169:             %% The environment trumps us,
  170:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  171:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  172:         false ->
  173:             [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, inet}]} | Config]
  174:     end;
  175: init_per_group(inet_backend_socket = _GroupName, Config) ->
  176:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  177:         true ->
  178:             %% The environment trumps us,
  179:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  180:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  181:         false ->
  182:             [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, socket}]} | Config]
  183:     end;
  184: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  185:     Config.
  186: 
  187: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  188:     Config.
  189: 
  190: 
  191: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  192:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> entry with"
  193:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  194:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  195:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  196:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  197:        [Config, erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  198: 
  199:     kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:reset_events(),
  200: 
  201:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> done when"
  202:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  203:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  204:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  205:     Config.
  206: 
  207: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  208:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> entry with"
  209:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  210:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  211:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  212:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  213:        [Config, erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  214: 
  215:     ?P("system events during test: "
  216:        "~n   ~p", [kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:events()]),
  217: 
  218:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> done with"
  219:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  220:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  221:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  222:     ok.
  223: 
  224: %% Test inet:setopt/getopt simple functionality.
  225: simple(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  226:     Cond = fun() ->
  227:                    %% case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
  228:                    %%     true ->
  229:                    %%         {skip, "'nopush' opt not (yet) implemented"};
  230:                    %%     false ->
  231:                    %%         ok
  232:                    %% end
  233:                    ok
  234:            end,
  235:     Pre  = fun() -> #{} end,
  236:     Case = fun(State) -> do_simple(Config, State) end,
  237:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  238:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
  239: 
  240: 
  241: do_simple(Config, _) when is_list(Config) ->
  242:     XOpt = case os:type() of
  243: 	       {unix,_} -> [{reuseaddr,true}];
  244: 	       _ -> []
  245: 	   end,
  246:     Opt = [{nodelay,true},
  247: 	   {keepalive,true},{packet,4},
  248: 	   {active,false}|XOpt],
  249:     OptTags = [X || {X,_} <- Opt],
  250:     {S1,S2} = create_socketpair(Config, Opt, Opt),
  251:     {ok,Opt} = inet:getopts(S1, OptTags),
  252:     {ok,Opt} = inet:getopts(S2, OptTags),
  253:     NoPushOpt = case os:type() of
  254:                     {unix, Osname} when Osname =:= linux;
  255:                                         Osname =:= freebsd -> {nopush, true};
  256:                     {_,_} -> {nopush, false}
  257:                 end,
  258:     COpt = [{X,case X of nodelay -> false;_ -> Y end} ||
  259:                {X,Y} <- [NoPushOpt|Opt]],
  260:     COptTags = [X || {X,_} <- COpt],
  261:     ?P("S1: set options:"
  262:        "~n   ~p", [COpt]),
  263:     inet:setopts(S1,COpt),
  264:     ?P("S1: get options: "
  265:        "~n   ~p", [COptTags]),
  266:     %% {ok,COpt} = inet:getopts(S1,COptTags),
  267:     case inet:getopts(S1,COptTags) of
  268:         {ok,COpt} ->
  269:             ?P("S1: success"),
  270:             ok;
  271:         {ok, COptErr} ->
  272:             ?P("S1: incorrect success:"
  273:                "~n   Expected: ~p"
  274:                "~n   Received: ~p", [COpt, COptErr]),
  275:             ct:fail({incorrect_success, COpt, COptErr});
  276:         {error, CReason} ->
  277:             ?P("S1: unexpected failure:"
  278:                "~n   ~p", [CReason]),
  279:             ct:fail({unexpected_failure, CReason})
  280:     end,
  281:     ?P("S2: get options: "
  282:        "~n   ~p", [OptTags]),
  283:     %% {ok,Opt} = inet:getopts(S2,OptTags),
  284:     case inet:getopts(S2,OptTags) of
  285:         {ok, Opt} ->
  286:             ?P("S2: success"),
  287:             ok;
  288:         {ok, OptErr} ->
  289:             ?P("S2: incorrect success:"
  290:                "~n   Expected: ~p"
  291:                "~n   Received: ~p", [Opt, OptErr]),
  292:             ct:fail({incorrect_success, Opt, OptErr});
  293:         {error, Reason} ->
  294:             ?P("S2: unexpected failure:"
  295:                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
  296:             ct:fail({unexpected_failure, Reason})
  297:     end,
  298:     gen_tcp:close(S1),
  299:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  300:     ok.
  301: 
  302: %% Loop through all socket options and check that they work.
  303: loop_all(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  304:     Cond = fun() ->
  305:                    case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
  306:                        true ->
  307:                            {skip, "Watermark options not (yet) implemented"};
  308:                        false ->
  309:                            ok
  310:                    end
  311:            end,
  312:     Pre  = fun() -> #{} end,
  313:     Case = fun(State) -> do_loop_all(Config, State) end,
  314:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  315:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
  316: 
  317: do_loop_all(Config, _) ->
  318:     ListenFailures =
  319: 	lists:foldr(make_check_fun(Config, listen),[],all_listen_options()),
  320:     AcceptFailures =
  321: 	lists:foldr(make_check_fun(Config, accept),[],all_accept_options()),
  322:     ConnectFailures =
  323: 	lists:foldr(make_check_fun(Config, connect),[],all_connect_options()),
  324:     UdpFailures =
  325: 	lists:foldr(make_check_fun(Config),[],all_udp_options()),
  326:     case ListenFailures++AcceptFailures++ConnectFailures++UdpFailures of
  327: 	[] ->
  328: 	    ok;
  329: 	Failed ->
  330: 	    {comment,lists:flatten(
  331: 		       io_lib:format("Non mandatory failed:~w",
  332: 				     [Failed]))}
  333:     end.
  334: 
  335: 
  336: 
  337: %% Test simple setopt/getopt of raw options.
  338: simple_raw(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  339:     do_simple_raw(Config, false).
  340: 
  341: %% Test simple setopt/getopt of raw options, with binaries in getopt.
  342: simple_raw_getbin(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  343:     do_simple_raw(Config, true).
  344: 
  345: do_simple_raw(Config, Binary) when is_list(Config) ->
  346:     Port = start_helper(Config),
  347:     SolSocket = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SOL_SOCKET),
  348:     SoKeepAlive = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SO_KEEPALIVE),
  349:     OptionTrue = {raw,SolSocket,SoKeepAlive,<<1:32/native>>},
  350:     OptionFalse = {raw,SolSocket,SoKeepAlive,<<0:32/native>>},
  351:     {S1,S2} = create_socketpair(Config, [OptionTrue],[{keepalive,true}]),
  352:     {ok,[{keepalive,true}]} = inet:getopts(S1,[keepalive]),
  353:     {ok,[{keepalive,true}]} = inet:getopts(S2,[keepalive]),
  354:     {ok,[{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepAlive,X1B}]} =
  355: 	inet:getopts(S1,[{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepAlive,binarify(4,Binary)}]),
  356:     X1 = nintbin2int(X1B),
  357:     {ok,[{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepAlive,X2B}]} =
  358: 	inet:getopts(S2,[{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepAlive,binarify(4,Binary)}]),
  359:     X2 = nintbin2int(X2B),
  360:     true = X1 > 0,
  361:     true = X2 > 0,
  362:     inet:setopts(S1,[{keepalive,false}]),
  363:     inet:setopts(S2,[OptionFalse]),
  364:     {ok,[{keepalive,false}]} = inet:getopts(S1,[keepalive]),
  365:     {ok,[{keepalive,false}]} = inet:getopts(S2,[keepalive]),
  366:     {ok,[{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepAlive,Y1B}]} =
  367: 	inet:getopts(S1,[{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepAlive,binarify(4,Binary)}]),
  368:     Y1 = nintbin2int(Y1B),
  369:     {ok,[{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepAlive,Y2B}]} =
  370: 	inet:getopts(S2,[{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepAlive,binarify(4,Binary)}]),
  371:     Y2 = nintbin2int(Y2B),
  372:     true = Y1 == 0,
  373:     true = Y2 == 0,
  374:     gen_tcp:close(S1),
  375:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  376:     stop_helper(Port),
  377:     ok.
  378: 
  379: nintbin2int(<<Int:32/native>>) -> Int;
  380: nintbin2int(<<Int:24/native>>) -> Int;
  381: nintbin2int(<<Int:16/native>>) -> Int;
  382: nintbin2int(<<Int:8/native>>) -> Int;
  383: nintbin2int(<<>>) -> 0.
  384: 
  385: 
  386: 
  387: %% Test setopt/getopt of multiple raw options.
  388: multiple_raw(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  389:     Cond = fun() -> is_not_openbsd() end,
  390:     Pre  = fun() -> false end,
  391:     Case = fun(State) -> do_multiple_raw(Config, State) end,
  392:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  393:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
  394:     
  395: 
  396: %% Test setopt/getopt of multiple raw options, with binaries in
  397: %% getopt.
  398: multiple_raw_getbin(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  399:     Cond = fun() -> is_not_openbsd() end,
  400:     Pre  = fun() -> true end,
  401:     Case = fun(State) -> do_multiple_raw(Config, State) end,
  402:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  403:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
  404: 
  405: do_multiple_raw(Config, Binary) ->
  406:     Port             = start_helper(Config),
  407:     SolSocket        = ask_helper(Port, ?C_GET_SOL_SOCKET),
  408:     SoKeepalive      = ask_helper(Port, ?C_GET_SO_KEEPALIVE),
  409:     SoKeepaliveTrue  = {raw,SolSocket,SoKeepalive,<<1:32/native>>},
  410:     SoKeepaliveFalse = {raw,SolSocket,SoKeepalive,<<0:32/native>>},
  411:     SoDontroute      = ask_helper(Port, ?C_GET_SO_DONTROUTE),
  412:     SoDontrouteTrue  = {raw,SolSocket,SoDontroute,<<1:32/native>>},
  413:     SoDontrouteFalse = {raw,SolSocket,SoDontroute,<<0:32/native>>},
  414:     {S1,S2} =
  415: 	create_socketpair(
  416:           Config,
  417: 	  [SoDontrouteFalse,SoKeepaliveTrue],
  418: 	  [SoKeepaliveFalse,SoDontrouteTrue]),
  419:     {ok,[{dontroute,false},{keepalive,true}]} =
  420: 	inet:getopts(S1, [dontroute,keepalive]),
  421:     {ok,
  422:      [{raw,SolSocket,SoDontroute,S1R1},
  423:       {raw,SolSocket,SoKeepalive,S1K1}]} =
  424: 	inet:getopts(
  425: 	  S1,
  426: 	  [{raw,SolSocket,SoDontroute,binarify(4, Binary)},
  427: 	   {raw,SolSocket,SoKeepalive,binarify(4, Binary)}]),
  428:     true = nintbin2int(S1R1) =:= 0,
  429:     true = nintbin2int(S1K1) =/= 0,
  430:     {ok,[{keepalive,false},{dontroute,true}]} =
  431: 	inet:getopts(S2, [keepalive,dontroute]),
  432:     {ok,
  433:      [{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepalive,S2K1},
  434:       {raw,SolSocket,SoDontroute,S2R1}]} =
  435: 	inet:getopts(
  436: 	  S2,
  437: 	  [{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepalive,binarify(4, Binary)},
  438: 	   {raw,SolSocket,SoDontroute,binarify(4, Binary)}]),
  439:     true = nintbin2int(S2K1) =:= 0,
  440:     true = nintbin2int(S2R1) =/= 0,
  441:     %%
  442:     ok = inet:setopts(
  443: 	   S1, [SoDontrouteTrue,SoKeepaliveFalse]),
  444:     ok = inet:setopts(
  445: 	   S2, [SoKeepaliveTrue,SoDontrouteFalse]),
  446:     {ok,
  447:      [{raw,SolSocket,SoDontroute,S1R2},
  448:       {raw,SolSocket,SoKeepalive,S1K2}]} =
  449: 	inet:getopts(
  450: 	  S1,
  451: 	  [{raw,SolSocket,SoDontroute,binarify(4, Binary)},
  452: 	   {raw,SolSocket,SoKeepalive,binarify(4, Binary)}]),
  453:     true = nintbin2int(S1R2) =/= 0,
  454:     true = nintbin2int(S1K2) =:= 0,
  455:     {ok,
  456:      [{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepalive,S2K2},
  457:       {raw,SolSocket,SoDontroute,S2R2}]} =
  458: 	inet:getopts(
  459: 	  S2,
  460: 	  [{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepalive,binarify(4, Binary)},
  461: 	   {raw,SolSocket,SoDontroute,binarify(4, Binary)}]),
  462:     true = nintbin2int(S2K2) =/= 0,
  463:     true = nintbin2int(S2R2) =:= 0,
  464:     %%
  465:     gen_tcp:close(S1),
  466:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  467:     stop_helper(Port),
  468:     ok.
  469: 
  470: 
  471: 
  472: %% Test that the example code from the documentation works.
  473: doc_examples_raw(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  474:     do_doc_examples_raw(Config, false).
  475: 
  476: %% Test that the example code from the documentation works when getopt
  477: %% uses binaries.
  478: doc_examples_raw_getbin(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  479:     do_doc_examples_raw(Config,true).
  480: 
  481: do_doc_examples_raw(Config, Binary) when is_list(Config) ->
  482:     Port              = start_helper(Config),
  483:     Proto             = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_IPPROTO_TCP),
  484:     TcpInfo           = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_TCP_INFO),
  485:     TcpInfoSize       = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_TCP_INFO_SIZE),
  486:     TcpiSackedOffset  = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_OFF_TCPI_SACKED),
  487:     TcpiOptionsOffset = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_OFF_TCPI_OPTIONS),
  488:     TcpiSackedSize    = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SIZ_TCPI_SACKED),
  489:     TcpiOptionsSize   = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SIZ_TCPI_OPTIONS),
  490:     TcpLinger2        = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_TCP_LINGER2),
  491:     stop_helper(Port),
  492:     case all_ok([Proto,TcpInfo,TcpInfoSize,TcpiSackedOffset,
  493: 		 TcpiOptionsOffset,TcpiSackedSize,TcpiOptionsSize,
  494: 		 TcpLinger2]) of
  495: 	false ->
  496: 	    {skipped,"Does not run on this OS."};
  497: 	true ->
  498: 	    {Sock,I} = create_socketpair(Config, [], []),
  499: 	    {ok,[{raw,Proto,TcpLinger2,<<OrigLinger:32/native>>}]} =
  500: 		inet:getopts(Sock,[{raw,Proto,TcpLinger2,binarify(4,Binary)}]),
  501: 	    NewLinger = OrigLinger div 2,
  502: 	    ok = inet:setopts(Sock,[{raw,Proto,TcpLinger2,
  503: 				     <<NewLinger:32/native>>}]),
  504: 	    {ok,[{raw,Proto,TcpLinger2,<<NewLinger:32/native>>}]} =
  505: 		inet:getopts(Sock,[{raw,Proto,TcpLinger2,binarify(4,Binary)}]),
  506: 	    ok = inet:setopts(Sock,[{raw,Proto,TcpLinger2,
  507: 				     <<OrigLinger:32/native>>}]),
  508: 	    {ok,[{raw,Proto,TcpLinger2,<<OrigLinger:32/native>>}]} =
  509: 		inet:getopts(Sock,[{raw,Proto,TcpLinger2,binarify(4,Binary)}]),
  510: 	    {ok,[{raw,_,_,Info}]} =
  511: 		inet:getopts(Sock,[{raw,Proto,TcpInfo,
  512: 				    binarify(TcpInfoSize,Binary)}]),
  513: 	    Bit1 = TcpiSackedSize * 8,
  514:             <<_:TcpiSackedOffset/binary,
  515: 	      TcpiSacked:Bit1/native,_/binary>> =
  516: 		Info,
  517: 	    0 = TcpiSacked,
  518: 	    Bit2 = TcpiOptionsSize * 8,
  519:             <<_:TcpiOptionsOffset/binary,
  520: 	      TcpiOptions:Bit2/native,_/binary>> =
  521: 		Info,
  522: 	    true = TcpiOptions =/= 0,
  523: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock),
  524: 	    gen_tcp:close(I),
  525: 	    ok
  526:     end.
  527: 
  528: %% Test structs and large/too large buffers when raw.
  529: large_raw(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  530:     do_large_raw(Config,false).
  531: 
  532: %% Test structs and large/too large buffers when raw
  533: %% using binaries to getopts.
  534: large_raw_getbin(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  535:     do_large_raw(Config,true).
  536: 
  537: do_large_raw(Config,Binary) when is_list(Config) ->
  538:     Port = start_helper(Config),
  539:     Proto = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SOL_SOCKET),
  540:     Linger = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SO_LINGER),
  541:     LingerSize = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_LINGER_SIZE),
  542:     LingerOnOffOffset = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_OFF_LINGER_L_ONOFF),
  543:     LingerLingerOffset = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_OFF_LINGER_L_LINGER),
  544:     LingerOnOffSize = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SIZ_LINGER_L_ONOFF),
  545:     LingerLingerSize = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SIZ_LINGER_L_LINGER),
  546:     stop_helper(Port),
  547:     case all_ok([Proto,Linger,LingerSize,LingerOnOffOffset,
  548: 		 LingerLingerOffset,LingerOnOffSize,LingerLingerSize]) of
  549: 	false ->
  550: 	    {skipped,"Does not run on this OS."};
  551: 	true ->
  552: 	    {Sock1,Sock2} = create_socketpair(Config,
  553:                                               [{linger,{true,10}}],
  554: 					      [{linger,{false,0}}]),
  555: 	    LargeSize = 1024,  % Solaris can take up to 1024*9,
  556: 						% linux 1024*63...
  557: 	    TooLargeSize = 1024*64,
  558: 	    {ok,[{raw,Proto,Linger,Linger1}]} =
  559: 		inet:getopts(Sock1,[{raw,Proto,Linger,
  560: 				     binarify(LargeSize,Binary)}]),
  561: 	    {ok,[{raw,Proto,Linger,Linger2}]} =
  562: 		inet:getopts(Sock2,[{raw,Proto,Linger,
  563: 				     binarify(LingerSize,Binary)}]),
  564: 	    true = byte_size(Linger1) =:= LingerSize,
  565: 	    LingerLingerBits = LingerLingerSize * 8,
  566: 	    LingerOnOffBits = LingerOnOffSize * 8,
  567: 	    <<_:LingerLingerOffset/binary,
  568: 	      Ling1:LingerLingerBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger1,
  569: 	    <<_:LingerOnOffOffset/binary,
  570: 	      Off1:LingerOnOffBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger1,
  571: 	    <<_:LingerOnOffOffset/binary,
  572: 	      Off2:LingerOnOffBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger2,
  573: 	    true = Off1 =/= 0,
  574: 	    true = Off2 == 0,
  575: 	    true = Ling1 == 10,
  576:             case {?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config),
  577:                   inet:getopts(Sock1,[{raw,Proto,Linger,TooLargeSize}])} of
  578:                 {false, {error,einval}} ->
  579:                     ok;
  580:                 {true,  {ok, _}} ->
  581:                     ok;
  582:                 {_, Unexpected} ->
  583:                     ?P("unexpected result: "
  584:                        "~n   ~p", [Unexpected]),
  585:                     ct:fail({unexpected, Unexpected})
  586:             end,
  587: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock1),
  588: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock2),
  589: 	    ok
  590:     end.
  591: 
  592: %% Test raw structs combined w/ other options .
  593: combined(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  594:     do_combined(Config,false).
  595: 
  596: %% Test raw structs combined w/ other options and
  597: %% binarise in getopts.
  598: combined_getbin(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  599:     do_combined(Config,true).
  600: 
  601: do_combined(Config,Binary) when is_list(Config) ->
  602:     Port = start_helper(Config),
  603:     Proto = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SOL_SOCKET),
  604:     Linger = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SO_LINGER),
  605:     LingerSize = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_LINGER_SIZE),
  606:     LingerOnOffOffset = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_OFF_LINGER_L_ONOFF),
  607:     LingerLingerOffset = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_OFF_LINGER_L_LINGER),
  608:     LingerOnOffSize = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SIZ_LINGER_L_ONOFF),
  609:     LingerLingerSize = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SIZ_LINGER_L_LINGER),
  610:     stop_helper(Port),
  611:     case all_ok([Proto,Linger,LingerSize,LingerOnOffOffset,
  612: 		 LingerLingerOffset,LingerOnOffSize,LingerLingerSize]) of
  613: 	false ->
  614: 	    {skipped,"Does not run on this OS."};
  615: 	true ->
  616: 	    LingerLingerBits = LingerLingerSize * 8,
  617: 	    LingerOnOffBits = LingerOnOffSize * 8,
  618: 	    {LingerOn,LingerOff} =
  619: 		case LingerOnOffOffset <  LingerLingerOffset of
  620: 		    true ->
  621: 			Pad1 =
  622: 			    list_to_binary(
  623: 			      lists:duplicate(LingerOnOffOffset,
  624: 					      0)),
  625: 			Pad2Siz =
  626: 			    LingerLingerOffset - LingerOnOffSize -
  627: 			    LingerOnOffOffset,
  628: 			Pad2 =
  629: 			    list_to_binary(
  630: 			      lists:duplicate(Pad2Siz,
  631: 					      0)),
  632: 			Pad3Siz = LingerSize - LingerLingerSize -
  633: 			    LingerLingerOffset,
  634: 			Pad3 = list_to_binary(
  635: 				 lists:duplicate(Pad3Siz,
  636: 						 0)),
  637: 			{<<Pad1/binary,1:LingerOnOffBits/native,
  638: 			   Pad2/binary,10:LingerLingerBits/native,
  639: 			   Pad3/binary>>,
  640: 			 <<Pad1/binary,0:LingerOnOffBits/native,
  641: 			   Pad2/binary,0:LingerLingerBits/native,
  642: 			   Pad3/binary>>};
  643: 		    false ->
  644: 			Pad1 =
  645: 			    list_to_binary(
  646: 			      lists:duplicate(LingerLingerOffset,
  647: 					      0)),
  648: 			Pad2Siz =
  649: 			    LingerOnOffOffset - LingerLingerSize -
  650: 			    LingerLingerOffset,
  651: 			Pad2 =
  652: 			    list_to_binary(
  653: 			      lists:duplicate(Pad2Siz,
  654: 					      0)),
  655: 			Pad3Siz = LingerSize - LingerOnOffSize -
  656: 			    LingerOnOffOffset,
  657: 			Pad3 = list_to_binary(
  658: 				 lists:duplicate(Pad3Siz,
  659: 						 0)),
  660: 			{<<Pad1/binary,1:LingerLingerBits/native,
  661: 			   Pad2/binary,10:LingerOnOffBits/native,
  662: 			   Pad3/binary>>,
  663: 			 <<Pad1/binary,0:LingerLingerBits/native,
  664: 			   Pad2/binary,0:LingerOnOffBits/native,
  665: 			   Pad3/binary>>}
  666: 		end,
  667: 	    RawLingerOn = {raw,Proto,Linger,LingerOn},
  668: 	    RawLingerOff = {raw,Proto,Linger,LingerOff},
  669: 	    {Sock1,Sock2} =
  670: 		create_socketpair(Config,
  671:                                   [{keepalive,true},
  672: 				   RawLingerOn],
  673: 				  [{keepalive,false},
  674: 				   RawLingerOff]),
  675: 	    {ok,[{raw,Proto,Linger,Linger1},{keepalive,Keep1}]} =
  676: 		inet:getopts(Sock1,[{raw,Proto,Linger, 
  677: 				     binarify(LingerSize,Binary)},keepalive]),
  678: 	    {ok,[{raw,Proto,Linger,Linger2},{keepalive,Keep2}]} =
  679: 		inet:getopts(Sock2,[{raw,Proto,Linger,
  680: 				     binarify(LingerSize,Binary)},keepalive]),
  681: 	    true = byte_size(Linger1) =:= LingerSize,
  682: 	    <<_:LingerLingerOffset/binary,
  683: 	      Ling1:LingerLingerBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger1,
  684: 	    <<_:LingerOnOffOffset/binary,
  685: 	      Off1:LingerOnOffBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger1,
  686: 	    <<_:LingerOnOffOffset/binary,
  687: 	      Off2:LingerOnOffBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger2,
  688: 	    true = Off1 =/= 0,
  689: 	    true = Off2 == 0,
  690: 	    true = Ling1 == 10,
  691: 	    true = Keep1 =:= true,
  692: 	    true = Keep2 =:= false,
  693: 	    {Sock3,Sock4} =
  694: 		create_socketpair(Config,
  695:                                   [RawLingerOn,{keepalive,true}],
  696: 				  [RawLingerOff,{keepalive,false}]),
  697: 	    {ok,[{raw,Proto,Linger,Linger3},{keepalive,Keep3}]} =
  698: 		inet:getopts(Sock3,[{raw,Proto,Linger,
  699: 				     binarify(LingerSize,Binary)},keepalive]),
  700: 	    {ok,[{raw,Proto,Linger,Linger4},{keepalive,Keep4}]} =
  701: 		inet:getopts(Sock4,[{raw,Proto,Linger,
  702: 				     binarify(LingerSize,Binary)},keepalive]),
  703: 	    true = byte_size(Linger3) =:= LingerSize,
  704: 	    <<_:LingerLingerOffset/binary,
  705: 	      Ling3:LingerLingerBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger3,
  706: 	    <<_:LingerOnOffOffset/binary,
  707: 	      Off3:LingerOnOffBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger3,
  708: 	    <<_:LingerOnOffOffset/binary,
  709: 	      Off4:LingerOnOffBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger4,
  710: 	    true = Off3 =/= 0,
  711: 	    true = Off4 == 0,
  712: 	    true = Ling3 == 10,
  713: 	    true = Keep3 =:= true,
  714: 	    true = Keep4 =:= false,
  715: 	    {Sock5,Sock6} =
  716: 		create_socketpair(Config,
  717:                                   [{packet,4},RawLingerOn,{keepalive,true}],
  718: 				  [{packet,2},RawLingerOff,{keepalive,false}]),
  719: 	    {ok,[{packet,Pack5},{raw,Proto,Linger,Linger5},
  720: 		 {keepalive,Keep5}]} =
  721: 		inet:getopts(Sock5,[packet,{raw,Proto,Linger,
  722: 					    binarify(LingerSize,Binary)},
  723: 				    keepalive]),
  724: 	    {ok,[{packet,Pack6},{raw,Proto,Linger,Linger6},
  725: 		 {keepalive,Keep6}]} =
  726: 		inet:getopts(Sock6,[packet,{raw,Proto,Linger,
  727: 					    binarify(LingerSize,Binary)},
  728: 				    keepalive]),
  729: 	    true = byte_size(Linger5) =:= LingerSize,
  730: 	    <<_:LingerLingerOffset/binary,
  731: 	      Ling5:LingerLingerBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger5,
  732: 	    <<_:LingerOnOffOffset/binary,
  733: 	      Off5:LingerOnOffBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger5,
  734: 	    <<_:LingerOnOffOffset/binary,
  735: 	      Off6:LingerOnOffBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger6,
  736: 	    true = Off5 =/= 0,
  737: 	    true = Off6 == 0,
  738: 	    true = Ling5 == 10,
  739: 	    true = Keep5 =:= true,
  740: 	    true = Keep6 =:= false,
  741: 	    true = Pack5 =:= 4,
  742: 	    true = Pack6 =:= 2,
  743: 	    inet:setopts(Sock6,[{packet,4},RawLingerOn,
  744: 				{keepalive,true}]),
  745: 	    {ok,[{packet,Pack7},{raw,Proto,Linger,Linger7},
  746: 		 {keepalive,Keep7}]} =
  747: 		inet:getopts(Sock6,[packet,{raw,Proto,Linger,
  748: 					    binarify(LingerSize,Binary)},
  749: 				    keepalive]),
  750: 	    <<_:LingerOnOffOffset/binary,
  751: 	      Off7:LingerOnOffBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger7,
  752: 	    true = Off7 =/= 0,
  753: 	    true = Keep7 =:= true,
  754: 	    true = Pack7 =:= 4,
  755: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock1),
  756: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock2),
  757: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock3),
  758: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock4),
  759: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock5),
  760: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock6),
  761: 	    ok
  762:     end.
  763: 
  764: 
  765: 
  766: %% Test socket option ipv6_v6only for UDP.
  767: ipv6_v6only_udp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  768:     ipv6_v6only(Config, gen_udp).
  769: 
  770: %% Test socket option ipv6_v6only for TCP.
  771: ipv6_v6only_tcp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  772:     ipv6_v6only(Config, gen_tcp).
  773: 
  774: %% Test socket option ipv6_v6only for SCTP.
  775: ipv6_v6only_sctp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  776:     ipv6_v6only(Config, gen_sctp).
  777: 
  778: ipv6_v6only(Config, Module) when is_list(Config) ->
  779:     case ipv6_v6only_open(Module, []) of
  780: 	{ok,S1} ->
  781: 	    case inet:getopts(S1, [ipv6_v6only]) of
  782: 		{ok,[{ipv6_v6only,Default}]}
  783: 		  when is_boolean(Default) ->
  784: 		    ok =
  785: 			ipv6_v6only_close(Module, S1),
  786: 		    ipv6_v6only(Config, Module, Default);
  787: 		{ok,[]} ->
  788: 		    io:format("Not implemented.~n", []),
  789: 		    %% This list of OS:es where the option is
  790: 		    %% supposed to be not implemented is just
  791: 		    %% a guess, and may grow with time.
  792: 		    case {os:type(),os:version()} of
  793: 			{{unix,linux},{2,M,_}}
  794: 			  when M =< 4 -> ok
  795: 		    end,
  796: 		    %% At least this should work
  797: 		    {ok,S2} =
  798: 			ipv6_v6only_open(
  799: 			  Module,
  800: 			  [{ipv6_v6only,true}]),
  801: 		    ok =
  802: 			ipv6_v6only_close(Module, S2)
  803: 	    end;
  804: 	{error,_} ->
  805: 	    {skipped,"Socket type not supported"}
  806:     end.
  807: 
  808: ipv6_v6only(Config, Module, Default) when is_list(Config) ->
  809:     io:format("Default ~w.~n", [Default]),
  810:     {ok,S1} =
  811: 	ipv6_v6only_open(Module, [{ipv6_v6only,Default}]),
  812:     {ok,[{ipv6_v6only,Default}]} =
  813: 	inet:getopts(S1, [ipv6_v6only]),
  814:     ok =
  815: 	ipv6_v6only_close(Module, S1),
  816:     NotDefault = not Default,
  817:     case ipv6_v6only_open(Module, [{ipv6_v6only,NotDefault}]) of
  818: 	{ok,S2} ->
  819: 	    io:format("Read-write.~n", []),
  820: 	    {ok,[{ipv6_v6only,NotDefault}]} =
  821: 		inet:getopts(S2, [ipv6_v6only]),
  822: 	    ok;
  823: 	{error,einval} ->
  824: 	    io:format("Read-only.~n", []),
  825: 	    %% This option is known to be read-only and true
  826: 	    %% on Windows and OpenBSD
  827: 	    case os:type() of
  828: 		{unix,openbsd} when Default =:= true -> ok;
  829: 		{win32,_} when Default =:= true -> ok
  830: 	    end
  831:     end.
  832: 
  833: ipv6_v6only_open(Module, Opts) ->
  834:     Module:case Module of
  835: 	       gen_tcp -> listen;
  836: 	       _ -> open
  837: 	   end(0, [inet6|Opts]).
  838: 
  839: ipv6_v6only_close(Module, Socket) ->
  840:     Module:close(Socket).
  841: 
  842: 
  843: %% Test using socket option ipv6_v6only for UDP.
  844: use_ipv6_v6only_udp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  845:     ?TC_TRY(use_ipv6_v6only_udp,
  846: 	    fun() -> do_use_ipv6_v6only_udp(Config) end).
  847: 
  848: do_use_ipv6_v6only_udp(Config) ->
  849:     case gen_udp:open(0, [inet6,{ip,{0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1}}, {ipv6_v6only,true}]) of
  850: 	{ok,S6} ->
  851: 	    ?P("IPv6 socket option created - ensure ipv6_v6only"),
  852: 	    case inet:getopts(S6, [ipv6_v6only]) of
  853: 		{ok,[{ipv6_v6only,true}]} ->
  854: 		    use_ipv6_v6only_udp(Config, S6);
  855: 		{ok, Other} ->
  856: 		    ?P("IPv6 socket option created - "
  857: 		       "failed ensuring ipv6_v6only"),
  858: 		    exit({skip, {getopts, Other}})
  859: 	    end;
  860: 	{error, OReason} ->
  861: 	    ?P("failed create IPv6 socket: "
  862: 	       "~n   ~p", [OReason]),
  863: 	    exit({skip, "Socket type not supported"})
  864:     end.
  865: 
  866: use_ipv6_v6only_udp(_Config, S6) ->
  867:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(S6),
  868:     ?P("IPv6 socket port number: ~w", [Port]),
  869:     S4 = case gen_udp:open(Port, [inet]) of
  870: 	     {ok, Sock4} ->
  871: 		 ?P("IPv4 socket created with port number ~w", [Port]),
  872: 		 Sock4;
  873: 	     {error, eaddrinuse = Reason} ->
  874: 		 ?P("failed create IPv4 socket: ~p => skip", [Reason]),
  875: 		 exit({skip, Reason});
  876: 	     {error, Reason} ->
  877: 		 ?P("failed create IPv4 socket: "
  878: 		    "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
  879: 		 ct:fail({failed_open, inet, Reason})
  880: 	 end,
  881:     E6 = " IPv6-echo.",
  882:     E4 = " IPv4-echo.",
  883:     {Sender, MRef} =
  884: 	spawn_monitor(fun () ->
  885: 			      use_ipv6_v6only_udp_sender(Port, E6, E4)
  886: 		      end),
  887:     use_ipv6_v6only_udp_listener(
  888:       S6, S4, E6, E4, Sender, MRef).
  889: 
  890: use_ipv6_v6only_udp_listener(S6, S4, E6, E4, Sender, Mref) ->
  891:     ?P("await upd message"),
  892:     receive
  893: 	{udp,S6,IP,P,Data} ->
  894: 	    ?P("received (IPv6) upd message"),
  895: 	    ok = gen_udp:send(S6, IP, P, [Data|E6]),
  896: 	    use_ipv6_v6only_udp_listener(S6, S4, E6, E4, Sender, Mref);
  897: 	{udp,S4,IP,P,Data} ->
  898: 	    ?P("received (IPv4) upd message"),
  899: 	    ok = gen_udp:send(S4, IP, P, [Data|E4]),
  900: 	    use_ipv6_v6only_udp_listener(S6, S4, E6, E4, Sender, Mref);
  901: 	{'DOWN', Mref,_,_, normal} ->
  902: 	    ?P("received expected normal down message"),
  903: 	    ok;
  904: 	{'DOWN', Mref,_,_, Result} ->
  905: 	    %% Since we are linked we will never arrive here
  906: 	    ?P("received expected down message: "
  907: 	       "~n   ~p", [Result]),
  908: 	    Result;
  909: 	Other ->
  910: 	    ?P("received unexpected message: "
  911: 	       "~n   ~p", [Other]),
  912: 	    exit({failed, {listener_unexpected, Other}})
  913:     end.
  914: 
  915: use_ipv6_v6only_udp_sender(Port, E6, E4) ->
  916:     D6 = "IPv6-send.",
  917:     D4 = "IPv4-send.",
  918:     R6 = D6 ++ E6,
  919:     R4 = D4 ++ E4,
  920:     R6 = sndrcv({0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1}, Port, [inet6], D6),
  921:     R4 = sndrcv({127,0,0,1}, Port, [inet], D4),
  922:     ok.
  923: 
  924: sndrcv(Ip, Port, Opts, Data) ->
  925:     {ok,S} = gen_udp:open(0, Opts),
  926:     ?P("[~w:~w] ! ~s", [Ip, Port, Data]),
  927:     ok = gen_udp:send(S, Ip, Port, Data),
  928:     receive
  929: 	{udp, S, Ip, Port, RecData} ->
  930: 	    ?P("[~w:~w] : ~s", [Ip, Port, RecData]),
  931: 	    RecData;
  932: 	Other ->
  933: 	    ?P("received unexpected message: "
  934: 	       "~n   ~p", [Other]),
  935: 	    exit({failed, {sndrcv_unexpectec, Other}})
  936:     end.
  937: 
  938: 
  939: 
  940: %% Test that raw data requests are not executed for bad types.
  941: type_errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  942:     BadSetOptions =
  943: 	[
  944: 	 {raw,x,3,<<1:32>>},
  945: 	 {raw,1,tre,<<1:32>>},
  946: 	 {raw,1,3,ko},
  947: 	 {raw,1,3,5},
  948: 	 {raw,1,3},
  949: 	 {raw,1},
  950: 	 {raw},
  951: 	 {raw,ett},
  952: 	 {raw,ett,tre},
  953: 	 {raw,{true,10}},
  954: 	 {raw,{ett,tre,<<1:32>>}},
  955: 	 {rav,1,3,<<1:32>>},
  956: 	 raw,
  957: 	 rav,
  958: 	 {linger,banan}
  959: 	],
  960:     BadGetOptions =
  961: 	[
  962: 	 {raw,x,3,<<1:32>>},
  963: 	 {raw,1,tre,<<1:32>>},
  964: 	 {raw,1,3,ko},
  965: 	 {raw,1,3,5.1},
  966: 	 {raw,1,3,-3},
  967: 	 {raw,1,3},
  968: 	 {raw,1},
  969: 	 {raw},
  970: 	 {raw,ett},
  971: 	 {raw,ett,tre},
  972: 	 {raw,{true,10}},
  973: 	 {raw,{ett,tre,<<1:32>>}},
  974: 	 {rav,1,3,<<1:32>>},
  975: 	 raw,
  976: 	 rav,
  977: 	 {linger,banan}
  978: 	],
  979:     lists:foreach(fun(Option) ->
  980: 			  case
  981: 			      catch create_socketpair(Config, [Option], []) of
  982: 			      {'EXIT',badarg} ->
  983: 				  ok;
  984: 			      Unexpected1 ->
  985: 				  exit({unexpected,
  986: 					Unexpected1})
  987: 			  end,
  988: 			  case
  989: 			      catch create_socketpair(Config, [], [Option]) of
  990: 			      {'EXIT', badarg} ->
  991: 				  ok;
  992: 			      Unexpected2 ->
  993: 				  exit({unexpected,
  994: 					Unexpected2})
  995: 			  end,
  996: 			  {Sock1,Sock2} = create_socketpair(Config, [], []),
  997: 			  case inet:setopts(Sock1, [Option]) of
  998: 			      {error, einval} ->
  999: 				  ok;
 1000: 			      Unexpected3 ->
 1001: 				  exit({unexpected,
 1002: 					Unexpected3})
 1003: 			  end,
 1004: 			  gen_tcp:close(Sock1),
 1005: 			  gen_tcp:close(Sock2)
 1006: 		  end,BadSetOptions),
 1007:     {Sock1,Sock2} = create_socketpair(Config, [], []),
 1008:     lists:foreach(fun(Option) ->
 1009: 			  case inet:getopts(Sock1, [Option]) of
 1010: 			      {error, einval} ->
 1011: 				  ok;
 1012: 			      Unexpected ->
 1013: 				  exit({unexpected,
 1014: 					Unexpected})
 1015: 			  end
 1016: 		  end,BadGetOptions),
 1017:     gen_tcp:close(Sock1),
 1018:     gen_tcp:close(Sock2),
 1019:     ok.
 1020: 
 1021: windows_reuseaddr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1022:     %% Check that emulation of reuseaddr and reuseport on Windows
 1023:     %% works as expected. That is, only set SO_REUSEADDR if both
 1024:     %% reuseaddr and reuseport are set.
 1025:     case os:type() of
 1026:         {win32, _} ->
 1027:             Port = start_helper(Config),
 1028:             Def = {ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SOL_SOCKET),
 1029:                    ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SO_REUSEADDR)},
 1030:             stop_helper(Port),
 1031:             {false, false} = windows_reuseaddr_test(Config,
 1032:                                                     Def,
 1033:                                                     [{reuseaddr,false},{reuseport,false}],
 1034:                                                     [{reuseaddr,false},{reuseport,false}]),
 1035:             {false, false} = windows_reuseaddr_test(Config,
 1036:                                                     Def,
 1037:                                                     [{reuseaddr,true},{reuseport,false}],
 1038:                                                     [{reuseaddr,true},{reuseport,false}]),
 1039:             {false, false} = windows_reuseaddr_test(Config,
 1040:                                                     Def,
 1041:                                                     [{reuseaddr,false},{reuseport,true}],
 1042:                                                     [{reuseaddr,false},{reuseport,true}]),
 1043:             {true, true} = windows_reuseaddr_test(Config,
 1044:                                                   Def,
 1045:                                                   [{reuseaddr,true},{reuseport,true}],
 1046:                                                   [{reuseaddr,true},{reuseport,true}]),
 1047:             ok;
 1048:         _ ->
 1049:             {skipped, "Test for Windows only"}
 1050:     end.
 1051: 
 1052: windows_reuseaddr_test(Config, {SolSocket, SoReuseaddr}, LOpts, COpts) ->
 1053:     OptNames = fun (Opts) ->
 1054:                        lists:map(fun ({Name,_}) -> Name end, Opts)
 1055:                end,
 1056:     {L,A,C} = create_socketpair_init(Config, LOpts, COpts),
 1057:     {ok, LOpts} = inet:getopts(L, OptNames(LOpts)),
 1058:     {ok, COpts} = inet:getopts(L, OptNames(COpts)),
 1059:     RawOpts = [{raw, SolSocket, SoReuseaddr, 4}],
 1060:     {ok,[{raw,SolSocket,SoReuseaddr,LRes}]} = inet:getopts(L, RawOpts),
 1061:     LReuseaddr = case nintbin2int(LRes) of
 1062:                      0 -> false;
 1063:                      _ -> true
 1064:                  end,
 1065:     {ok,[{raw,SolSocket,SoReuseaddr,CRes}]} = inet:getopts(L, RawOpts),
 1066:     CReuseaddr = case nintbin2int(CRes) of
 1067:                      0 -> false;
 1068:                      _ -> true
 1069:                  end,
 1070:     gen_tcp:close(L),
 1071:     gen_tcp:close(A),
 1072:     gen_tcp:close(C),
 1073:     {LReuseaddr, CReuseaddr}.
 1074: 
 1075: 
 1076: all_ok([]) ->
 1077:     true;
 1078: all_ok([H|T]) when H >= 0 ->
 1079:     all_ok(T);
 1080: all_ok(_) ->
 1081:     false.
 1082: 
 1083: 
 1084: make_check_fun(Config, Type) ->
 1085:     fun({Name,V1,V2,Mand,Chang},Acc) ->
 1086:             {LO1,CO1} = case Type of
 1087:                             connect -> {[],[{Name,V1}]};
 1088:                             _ -> {[{Name,V1}],[]}
 1089:                         end,
 1090:             {LO2,CO2} = case Type of
 1091:                             connect -> {[],[{Name,V2}]};
 1092:                             _ -> {[{Name,V2}],[]}
 1093:                         end,
 1094: 	    {X1,Y1,Z1} = create_socketpair_init(Config, LO1, CO1),
 1095: 	    {X2,Y2,Z2} = create_socketpair_init(Config, LO2, CO2),
 1096:             {S1,S2} = case Type of
 1097:                           listen -> {X1,X2};
 1098:                           accept -> {Y1,Y2};
 1099:                           connect -> {Z1,Z2}
 1100:                       end,
 1101: 	    {ok,[{Name,R1}]} = inet:getopts(S1,[Name]),
 1102: 	    {ok,[{Name,R2}]} = inet:getopts(S2,[Name]),
 1103: 	    NewAcc =
 1104: 		case R1 =/= R2 of
 1105: 		    true ->
 1106: 			case Chang of
 1107: 			    true ->
 1108: 				inet:setopts(S1,[{Name,V2}]),
 1109: 				{ok,[{Name,R3}]} =
 1110: 				    inet:getopts(S1,[Name]),
 1111: 				case {R3 =/= R1, R3 =:= R2} of
 1112: 				    {true,true} ->
 1113: 					Acc;
 1114: 				    _ ->
 1115: 					case Mand of
 1116: 					    true ->
 1117: 						exit
 1118: 						  ({failed_sockopt,
 1119: 						    {change,
 1120: 						     Name}});
 1121: 					    false ->
 1122: 						[{change,Name}|Acc]
 1123: 					end
 1124: 				end;
 1125: 			    false ->
 1126: 				Acc
 1127: 			end;
 1128: 		    false ->
 1129: 			case Mand of
 1130: 			    true ->
 1131: 				exit({failed_sockopt,
 1132: 				      {Type,Name}});
 1133: 			    false ->
 1134: 				[{Type,Name}|Acc]
 1135: 			end
 1136: 		end,
 1137: 	    gen_tcp:close(X1),
 1138: 	    gen_tcp:close(Y1),
 1139: 	    gen_tcp:close(Z1),
 1140: 	    gen_tcp:close(X2),
 1141: 	    gen_tcp:close(Y2),
 1142: 	    gen_tcp:close(Z2),
 1143: 	    NewAcc
 1144:     end.
 1145: 
 1146: make_check_fun(_Config) ->
 1147:     fun ({Name,V1,V2,Mand,Chang} = Spec, Acc) ->
 1148:             try
 1149:                 {ok,S1} = gen_udp:open(0, [{Name,V1}]),
 1150:                 {ok,S2} = gen_udp:open(0, [{Name,V2}]),
 1151:                 try
 1152:                     {ok,[{Name,R1}]} = inet:getopts(S1, [Name]),
 1153:                     {ok,[{Name,R2}]} = inet:getopts(S2, [Name]),
 1154:                     case R1 =/= R2 of
 1155:                         true ->
 1156:                             case Chang of
 1157:                                 true ->
 1158:                                     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{Name,V2}]),
 1159:                                     {ok,[{Name,R3}]} =
 1160:                                         inet:getopts(S1, [Name]),
 1161:                                     if
 1162:                                         R3 =/= R1, R3 =:= R2 ->
 1163:                                             Acc;
 1164:                                         true ->
 1165:                                             case Mand of
 1166:                                                 true ->
 1167:                                                     exit(
 1168:                                                       {failed_sockopt,
 1169:                                                        {change,Name}});
 1170:                                                 false ->
 1171:                                                     [{change,Name}|Acc]
 1172:                                             end
 1173:                                     end;
 1174:                                 false ->
 1175:                                     Acc
 1176:                             end;
 1177:                         false ->
 1178:                             case Mand of
 1179:                                 true ->
 1180:                                     exit({failed_sockopt, {udp,Name}});
 1181:                                 false ->
 1182:                                     [{udp,Name}|Acc]
 1183:                             end
 1184:                     end
 1185:                 after
 1186:                     gen_udp:close(S1),
 1187:                     gen_udp:close(S2)
 1188:                 end
 1189:             catch Class : Reason : Stacktrace ->
 1190:                     erlang:raise(Class, {fail,Reason,Spec}, Stacktrace)
 1191:             end
 1192:     end.
 1193: 
 1194: %% {OptionName,Value1,Value2,Mandatory,Changeable}
 1195: all_listen_options() ->
 1196:     OsType = os:type(),
 1197:     OsVersion = os:version(),
 1198:     [{tos,0,1,false,true}, 
 1199:      {priority,0,1,false,true}, 
 1200:      {reuseaddr,false,true,mandatory_reuseaddr(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1201:      {reuseport,false,true,mandatory_reuseport(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1202:      {reuseport_lb,false,true,mandatory_reuseport_lb(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1203:      {exclusiveaddruse,false,true,mandatory_exclusiveaddruse(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1204:      {keepalive,false,true,true,true}, 
 1205:      {linger, {false,10}, {true,10},true,true},
 1206:      {sndbuf,2048,4096,false,true}, 
 1207:      {recbuf,2048,4096,false,true}, 
 1208:      {nodelay,false,true,true,true},
 1209:      {header,2,4,true,true}, 
 1210:      {active,false,true,true,false}, 
 1211:      {packet,2,4,true,true}, 
 1212:      {buffer,1000,2000,true,true}, 
 1213:      {mode,list,binary,true,true}, 
 1214:      {deliver,term,port,true,true}, 
 1215:      {exit_on_close, true, false, true, true},
 1216:      {high_watermark,4096,8192,true,true}, 
 1217:      {low_watermark,2048,4096,true,true}, 
 1218:      {high_msgq_watermark,4096,8192,true,true}, 
 1219:      {low_msgq_watermark,2048,4096,true,true}, 
 1220:      {send_timeout,infinity,1000,true,true},
 1221:      {send_timeout_close,false,true,true,true},
 1222:      {delay_send,false,true,true,true}, 
 1223:      {packet_size,0,4,true,true}
 1224:     ].
 1225: 
 1226: all_accept_options() ->
 1227:     A0 = lists:keydelete(exclusiveaddruse, 1, all_listen_options()),
 1228:     A1 = lists:keydelete(reuseaddr, 1, A0),
 1229:     A2 = lists:keydelete(reuseport, 1, A1),
 1230:     lists:keydelete(reuseport_lb, 1, A2).
 1231: 
 1232: all_connect_options() ->
 1233:     OsType = os:type(),
 1234:     OsVersion = os:version(),
 1235:     [{tos,0,1,false,true}, 
 1236:      {priority,0,1,false,true}, 
 1237:      {reuseaddr,false,true,mandatory_reuseaddr(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1238:      {reuseport,false,true,mandatory_reuseport(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1239:      {reuseport_lb,false,true,mandatory_reuseport_lb(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1240:      {exclusiveaddruse,false,true,mandatory_exclusiveaddruse(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1241:      {keepalive,false,true,true,true}, 
 1242:      {linger, {false,10}, {true,10},true,true},
 1243:      {sndbuf,2048,4096,false,true}, 
 1244:      {recbuf,2048,4096,false,true}, 
 1245:      {nodelay,false,true,true,true},
 1246:      {header,2,4,true,true}, 
 1247:      {active,false,true,true,false}, 
 1248:      {packet,2,4,true,true}, 
 1249:      {buffer,1000,2000,true,true}, 
 1250:      {mode,list,binary,true,true}, 
 1251:      {deliver,term,port,true,true}, 
 1252:      {exit_on_close, true, false, true, true},
 1253:      {high_watermark,4096,8192,false,true}, 
 1254:      {low_watermark,2048,4096,false,true}, 
 1255:      {high_msgq_watermark,4096,8192,true,true}, 
 1256:      {low_msgq_watermark,2048,4096,true,true}, 
 1257:      {send_timeout,infinity,1000,true,true},
 1258:      {send_timeout_close,false,true,true,true},
 1259:      {delay_send,false,true,true,true}, 
 1260:      {packet_size,0,4,true,true}
 1261:     ].
 1262: 
 1263: 
 1264: all_udp_options() ->
 1265:     OsType = os:type(),
 1266:     OsVersion = os:version(),
 1267:     [{tos,0,1,false,true},
 1268:      {priority,0,1,false,true},
 1269:      {reuseaddr,false,true,mandatory_reuseaddr(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1270:      {reuseport,false,true,mandatory_reuseport(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1271:      {reuseport_lb,false,true,mandatory_reuseport_lb(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1272:      {exclusiveaddruse,false,true,
 1273:       mandatory_exclusiveaddruse(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1274:      {sndbuf,2048,4096,false,true},
 1275:      {recbuf,2048,4096,false,true},
 1276:      {header,2,4,true,true},
 1277:      {active,false,true,true,false},
 1278:      {buffer,1000,2000,true,true},
 1279:      {mode,list,binary,true,true},
 1280:      {deliver,term,port,true,true},
 1281:      {broadcast,true,false,true,true},
 1282:      {dontroute,true,false,
 1283:       lists:member(OsType, [{unix,linux},{unix,freebsd},{unix,darwin}]),
 1284:       true},
 1285:      %% multicast_if
 1286:      %% multicast_ttl
 1287:      %% multicast_loop
 1288:      %% add_membership
 1289:      %% drop_membership
 1290:      {read_packets,6,7,true,true},
 1291:      {high_msgq_watermark,4096,8192,true,true},
 1292:      {low_msgq_watermark,2048,4096,true,true}].
 1293: 
 1294: 
 1295: %% Mandatory on a lot of system other than those listed below. Please add more...
 1296: mandatory_reuseaddr({unix, linux}, _OsVersion) ->
 1297:     true;
 1298: mandatory_reuseaddr({unix, freebsd}, _OsVersion) ->
 1299:     true;
 1300: mandatory_reuseaddr({unix, darwin}, _OsVersion) ->
 1301:     true;
 1302: mandatory_reuseaddr({win32, _}, _OsVersion) ->
 1303:     true; %% reuseaddr and reuseport are emulated by the inet-driver
 1304: mandatory_reuseaddr(_OsType, _OsVersion) ->
 1305:     false.
 1306: 
 1307: %% Mandatory an a lot of system other than those listed below. Please add more...
 1308: mandatory_reuseport({win32, _}, _OsVersion) ->
 1309:     true; %% reuseaddr and reuseport are emulated by the inet-driver
 1310: mandatory_reuseport({unix, linux}, {X,Y,_Z}) when X > 4 orelse X == 4 andalso Y >= 6 ->
 1311:     true;
 1312: mandatory_reuseport({unix, freebsd}, {X,Y,_Z}) when X > 11 orelse X == 11 andalso Y >= 4 ->
 1313:     %% I know that it is available on 11.4, but it may be available earlier...
 1314:     true;
 1315: mandatory_reuseport({unix, darwin}, {X,Y,_Z}) when X > 26 orelse X == 26 andalso Y >= 6 ->
 1316:     %% I know that it is available on 26.6, but it may be available earlier...
 1317:     true;
 1318: mandatory_reuseport(_OsType, _OsVersion) ->
 1319:     false.
 1320: 
 1321: %% Perhaps mandatory an system other than those listed below. Please add more...
 1322: mandatory_reuseport_lb({unix, linux}, {X,Y,_Z}) when X > 4 orelse X == 4 andalso Y >= 6 ->
 1323:     true;
 1324: mandatory_reuseport_lb({unix, freebsd}, {X,Y,_Z}) when X > 13 orelse X == 13 andalso Y >= 1 ->
 1325:     %% I know that it is available on 13.1, but it may be available earlier...
 1326:     true;
 1327: mandatory_reuseport_lb(_OsType, _OsVersion) ->
 1328:     false.
 1329: 
 1330: mandatory_exclusiveaddruse({win32, _}, {X,Y,_Z}) when X > 5 orelse X == 5 andalso Y >= 2 ->
 1331:     true;
 1332: mandatory_exclusiveaddruse(_OsType, _OsVersion) ->
 1333:     false.
 1334: 
 1335: create_socketpair_init(Config, ListenOptions, ConnectOptions) ->
 1336:     {ok,LS}   = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, ListenOptions),
 1337:     {ok,Port} = inet:port(LS),
 1338:     {ok,CS}   = ?CONNECT(Config, localhost, Port, ConnectOptions),
 1339:     {ok,AS}   = gen_tcp:accept(LS),
 1340:     {LS,AS,CS}.
 1341: 
 1342: create_socketpair(Config, ListenOptions, ConnectOptions) ->
 1343:     {LS,AS,CS} = create_socketpair_init(Config, ListenOptions, ConnectOptions),
 1344:     gen_tcp:close(LS),
 1345:     {AS,CS}.
 1346: 
 1347: 
 1348: start_helper(Config) ->
 1349:     Progname = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "sockopt_helper"),
 1350:     Port = open_port({spawn,Progname},[eof,line]),
 1351:     Port.
 1352: 
 1353: ask_helper(Port,Code) ->
 1354:     Com = integer_to_list(Code)++"\n",
 1355:     Port ! {self(),{command,Com}},
 1356:     receive
 1357: 	{Port,{data,{eol,Text}}} ->
 1358: 	    list_to_integer(Text);
 1359: 	Other ->
 1360: 	    exit({error,{unexpected_data_from_helper,Other}})
 1361:     after 3000 ->
 1362: 	    exit({error,helper_timeout})
 1363:     end.
 1364: 
 1365: stop_helper(Port) ->
 1366:     catch ask_helper(Port,?C_QUIT),
 1367:     receive
 1368: 	{Port,eof} ->
 1369: 	    Port ! {self(), close},
 1370: 	    receive
 1371: 		{Port,closed} ->
 1372: 		    ok
 1373: 	    after 1000 ->
 1374: 		    timeout
 1375: 	    end
 1376:     after 1000 ->
 1377: 	    timeout
 1378:     end.
 1379: 
 1380: binarify(Size,Binary) when Binary =:= true ->
 1381:     <<0:Size/unit:8>>;
 1382: binarify(Size,Binary) when Binary =:= false ->
 1383:     Size.
 1384: 
 1385: 
 1386: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1387: 
 1388: %% Here are all the *general* test case condition functions.
 1389: 
 1390: is_not_openbsd() ->
 1391:     is_not_platform(openbsd, "OpenBSD").
 1392: 
 1393: is_not_platform(Platform, PlatformStr)
 1394:   when is_atom(Platform) andalso is_list(PlatformStr) ->
 1395:       case os:type() of
 1396:           {unix, Platform} ->
 1397:               skip("This does not work on " ++ PlatformStr);
 1398:         _ ->
 1399:             ok
 1400:     end.
 1401: 
 1402: 
 1403: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1404: 
 1405: skip(Reason) ->
 1406:     throw({skip, Reason}).
 1407: 
 1408: 
 1409: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1410: 
 1411: links() ->
 1412:     pi(links).
 1413: 
 1414: monitors() ->
 1415:     pi(monitors).
 1416: 
 1417: pi(Item) ->
 1418:     {Item, Val} = process_info(self(), Item),
 1419:     Val.
 1420:
